Epiphany Home Blessing Kits are available in both church vestibules through Jan. 18, and the Cabrini Food Pantry continues accepting weekly donations (including Friday drop-off hours).

Families can also note the Baptism class (Jan 11), First Communion parent meeting (Jan 13), and an upcoming St. Clement wine tasting (Jan 31). Regular community-building continues with coffee/donuts gatherings and guided church tours at St. James on the last Sunday of the month.

Upcoming gatherings also include Grandparents@Prayer and a Holy Trinity School Open House on January 13, plus a Knights of Columbus talk “Hope That Never Fails” at Father Ragan Hall on January 15. Ongoing programs include Magnify 90 for women and Exodus 90 for men, along with EDGE and Life Teen youth ministry.

events_summary: St. Albert the Great has several January faith-formation and community opportunities, including Alpha (9 Tuesday evenings starting Jan. 20) and the mental health talk series “A Path to Freedom” on Thursdays Jan. 8–29 (18:30–20:00). New parishioners are invited to Welcome Registration on Jan. 11 at 10:30 in Small Hall A, and young adults can attend the diocesan town hall meeting at the Parish Life Center on Jan. 14 at 18:30. Ongoing prayer includes Eucharistic Adoration Monday 08:00 through Friday 17:00, plus monthly “Revive” and third-Monday Healing Prayer/Anointing after the 11:30 Mass.

name: Saint Aloysius Parish
events_summary: Saint Aloysius Parish continues its regular Sunday Mass at 10:00 and is shifting its weekly weekday Mass to Tuesdays at 11:30 beginning in January. Upcoming highlights include the UJAMAA Awards during Mass on January 25 with breakfast afterward, and the parish-hosted Diocesan Revival February 18–20. Additional January gatherings include a revival prep meeting (Jan 8), a Finance Council meeting (Jan 17), and a special visit from the Irish Order of Hibernians at the Jan 18 liturgy.

name: Saint Bernard Parish
events_summary: St. Bernard Parish offers weekly Newman Nights on Wednesdays at 18:30 through ROOCatholic Campus Ministry. Upcoming parish activities include a Bridal Gown Sale volunteer meeting on Saturday, 2026-01-17 at 13:00 in the Social Hall, and a Bridal Gown/Quinceañera Dress Sale on Saturday, 2026-02-21 from 11:00–15:00. The parish is also promoting its 5th Annual Mardi Gras Night at the Races fundraiser (Saturday, start time 17:30) benefiting St. Bernard’s Hunger Programs.
